data.title: How many countries are there in the world?
meta_keywords: How many Countries are there in the World
How many Countries are there in the World 2022
data.meta_description: List of countries and their capitals: There are 195 countries in the world. Check the complete list here.
data.text:
Today, there are 195 nations in the world. This total includes the Holy See and the State of Palestine, two non-member observer states, along with the 193 United Nations member states. Check the complete list here:

List of countries in the world: There are a total of 195 countries in the world, of which 193 are UN member states while 2 are non-member observer states - the Vatican and Palestine. Fifty-four of these countries are located in Africa, forty-eight in Asia, forty-four in Europe, thirty-three in Latin America and the Caribbean, fourteen in Oceania, and two in Northern America.

READ | What are the seven continents and their countries?

10 Interesting Facts About Different Countries

Brazil is home to the Amazon Rainforest, which is the largest tropical rainforest in the world, covering about 60% of the country's territory.

Australia is the only country that is also a continent.

Iceland, the "Land of Fire and Ice" does not have a standing army and is considered one of the most peaceful countries in the world.

Japan has the highest life expectancy in the world.

Egypt is home to the Great Pyramid of Giza, one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.

Canada has the longest coastline of any country in the world, stretching over 202,080 kilometres (125,567 miles).

Norway is the birthplace of the Nobel Peace Prize.

India is the world's largest democracy and the second-most populous country.

South Africa is home to the "Big Five" animals: lions, elephants, rhinoceroses, leopards, and buffalos.

Italy is home to the Colosseum, an ancient amphitheatre in Rome that was used for gladiatorial contests and other public spectacles.

DISCLAIMER: The World's Map has been updated in this article.
